title: Apple’s Thunderbolt 4 Pro Cable teardown shows why the accessory is expensive
content:
When Apple announced Mac Studio and Studio Display earlier this year, the company also quietly introduced a new Thunderbolt 4 Pro Cable capable of up to 40Gb/s data transfer and charging up to 100W. While it comes with the high price of $129, a new teardown of the cable shows why the accessory is super expensive.

more…

The post Apple’s Thunderbolt 4 Pro Cable teardown shows why the accessory is expensive appeared first on 9to5Mac.
description: A teardown video by ChargerLAB shows all the details and specifications of Apple's new Thunderbolt 4 Pro Cable.
